title: Electron and proton near a charged sphere

content.question: A uniformly charged, nonconducting sphere is held at a fixed position. When a proton is outside the sphere at a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> from the center of the sphere, the magnitude of the acceleration of the proton is <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>. If an electron is at a distance <math alttext="2 D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi></math> from the center of the same sphere, what is the magnitude of the acceleration of the electron in terms of <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> ?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
